result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca Anne Flink was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apply bond on file and refund balance to payor.
DNA surcharge.
Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca Anne Flink

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bond refund ck#26434  returned by PO - Not deliverable as addressed. cah
JOC. Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward. hml
Recbecca Flink ck# 026434 sent this date. eif      Check returned by PO undeliverable 11-23-16.  Check voided and applied to balance due on 15FO479 per SRN. cah
c: Def, Atty, DA & SCSO. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly DF ATTY: Gail Marie Metheny DF:  Rebecca Anne Flink appeared. Case called at 1:48. ADA Kelly updates the court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to amended charge of 947.01 disorderly conduct in 15CM775. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1  in 15CM775 to 947.01 disorderly conduct. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement Crt orders:
-  Costs of $243.00
-  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
Apply bond on file return remaining to payor.
Rebecca Flink 16R 016945. eif
Per RMW 10/31/16 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Status conference on November 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, John O.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Joseph Caton for Gail Marie Metheny,  DF:  Rebecca Anne Flink appeared from jail via video.  Includes 15CM773 (RW) and 15FO479 (PayH). Court questions Defendant on non-appearance, she had car problems and was unable to attend. ADA Nieskes is requesting a $250.00 CB.  Defendant to meet with the payment clerk on 15FO479. QUASH WARRANT.  Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Signed by SRN. c: DA and SCSO. km

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Gail Marie Metheny DF: Rebecca Anne Flink did not appear. Case called at 8:30. Set for a plea hearing. Atty. Metheny updates the court. ADA Kelly responds. Court authorizes a Warrant with a $500 purge provision.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: DF: Rebecca Anne Flink appeared pro se. Case called at 9:13. Set for PTC. Court reviews file. DE has not contacted the PD office. Court questions DE and reviews her rights to an atty.  Court finds the DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives her right to any atty. ADA Hartung updates the court and would like to wait until the DE is represented. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
from the Public Defender's office re: appointment of Atty. gme
Per Judge Proctor 3/23/16 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2016 at 09:15 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, John O.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: Proctor for SRN, RPT: Kasten, Clerk: E. Ferrill, ADA: Matthew L Hartung,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Rebecca Anne Flink appeared from jail via video. Court confirms address. Defendant does qualify for PD.   QUASH WARRANT. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Statewide                  SRN signed 3/3/16 - c: DA & SCSO. eif

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Matthew L Hartung, NONA by def. Due to non-appearance State is requesting a warrant. Court issues a warrant with a purge provision of $1000.00 and IA.
